text:
CONCLUSIONS AND RECOMMENDATIONS 
 Although substantial exploration and mining was done for gold between 1898 and 
 1941, further investigations were not initiated until the period 1971 to 1981. 
 These activities initially comprised exploration of the extensive mapped areas of 
 felsic pyroclastic rocks for felsic Volcanic Hosted Massive Sulphide copper-zinc-
 silver deposits. Unfortunately these programmes failed to result in success. 
 During the period 1980 to the early 1990’s exploration activities mainly comprised 
 a search  for nickel-copper-cobalt  and platinum  group  metals together  with  gold. 
 programmes were done and all collected samples were analysed. 
 trenching  and  percussion  drilling 
 geological  mapping,  dump  sampling, 
 In 1997 Tullock Resources N.L. data for both a low level aeromagnetic survey and 
 Landsat TM imagery of covering an area of about 375km² (see Figure 4). 
 Previous sub-surface exploration of the project area has been confined to shallow 
 percussion  drilling  within  the  regolith.  No  attempt  has  been  made  to  locate  and 
 define  primary  sulphide  mineralisation  using  MMI  or  MAGLAG  sampling  and 
 It is recommended that trials of such methods be undertaken with high amplitude 
 priority targets being tested by drilling through the weathered rock profile and for 
 a substantial distance into fresh rock.

27.text: The  Kookynie  Project  tenements  are  located  within  the  Menzies  1:250,000

28.text: Geological Map Sheet being situated approximately adjacent to the eastern margin

29.text: of the Melita 1:100,000 Sheet (see Figures 2 and 3). The Project area lies within

30.text: the younger (2,800Ma to 2,600Ma) Central Norseman-Wiluna belt of the Eastern

31.text: Goldfields  Province  of  the  Archaean  Yilgarn  Craton,  Western  Australia  (W.K.

34.text: This belt hosts many major gold and nickel sulphide deposits including the “Sons

35.text: of  Gwalia”  gold  mine  at  Leonora  with  recorded  gold  production  exceeding  2.5

36.text: million ounces (more than 78 tonnes of gold).

38.text: The Melita map sheet is practically bisected by a north trending fault that was until

39.text: recently  correlated  with  the  Mount  George  Shear  Zone  which  branches  off  the

40.text: Moriaty  Shear  Zone.  Displacement  along  both  of  these  shear  zones  is  dextral.

41.text: More recent mapping (so far unpublished) has suggested that this north-trending

42.text: fault  may  be  more  correctly  correlated  with  the  “Butchers  Flat  Shear  Zone”

43.text: although information regarding this structure is neither plotted on the geological

46.text: It is anticipated that additional details of the abovementioned structural data will

47.text: be published by the Department of Industry and Resources - Geological Survey of

text:
The  Kookynie  Project  tenements  are  located  within  the  Menzies  1:250,000 
 Geological Map Sheet being situated approximately adjacent to the eastern margin 
 of the Melita 1:100,000 Sheet (see Figures 2 and 3). The Project area lies within 
 the younger (2,800Ma to 2,600Ma) Central Norseman-Wiluna belt of the Eastern 
 Goldfields  Province  of  the  Archaean  Yilgarn  Craton,  Western  Australia  (W.K. 
 This belt hosts many major gold and nickel sulphide deposits including the “Sons 
 of  Gwalia”  gold  mine  at  Leonora  with  recorded  gold  production  exceeding  2.5 
 million ounces (more than 78 tonnes of gold). 
 The Melita map sheet is practically bisected by a north trending fault that was until 
 recently  correlated  with  the  Mount  George  Shear  Zone  which  branches  off  the 
 Moriaty  Shear  Zone.  Displacement  along  both  of  these  shear  zones  is  dextral. 
 More recent mapping (so far unpublished) has suggested that this north-trending 
 fault  may  be  more  correctly  correlated  with  the  “Butchers  Flat  Shear  Zone” 
 although information regarding this structure is neither plotted on the geological 
 It is anticipated that additional details of the abovementioned structural data will 
 be published by the Department of Industry and Resources - Geological Survey of

 553,240 tonnes of ore. The Altona mine produced 7,716 ounces (240 kilograms) of

text:
Below the base of oxidation both mines exploited sulphidic ores. 
 During  the  period  1971  to  1981  exploration  was  done  by  Le  Nickel  (Australia) 
 Exploration Pty. Ltd. Union Miniere Development Corporation Limited, Western 
 Mining  Corporation  Limited  (“WMC”),  Asarco  (Australia)  Pty.  Ltd.,  and 
 Abminco  was  mainly  concentrated  on  a  search  for  Volcanic  Hosted  Massive 
 Sulphide  copper-zinc-silver  deposits  in  the  felsic  pyroclastic  and  sedimentary 
 sequences  of  the  area.  Although  this  work  was  generally  unsuccessful  diamond 
 drilling  by  WMC  one  hole  did  intersect  a  0.70m  width  of  massive  sulphide 
 assaying 4.70% copper within pyritic shale bans in basalt.      
 Uranium exploration sampling done at the same time yielded discouraging results.

 and  Western  Mining  Corporation  Limited  for  the  purpose  of  investigating  the
